Zend_Registry  
No 
No 

Description

Generic storage class helps to manage global data.

Methods

__construct, _unsetInstance, get, getInstance, init, isRegistered, offsetExists, set, setClassName, setInstance,

__construct( array   $array = array, integer   $flags = parent, ) : n/a

Description

Constructs a parent ArrayObject with default ARRAY_AS_PROPS to allow acces as an object

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$array array | data array array
$flags integer | ArrayObject flags parent

Return value

Type Description
n/a n/a

_unsetInstance( ) : n/a

Description

Unset the default registry instance.

Primarily used in tearDown() in unit tests.


Return value

Type Description
n/a n/a

Tags

Name Description
returns void

get( string   $index, ) : mixed

Description

getter method, basically same as offsetGet().

This method can be called from an object of type Zend_Registry, or it can be called statically. In the latter case, it uses the default static instance stored in the class.


Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$index string | - get the value associated with $index

Return value

Type Description
mixed

Tags

Name Description
throws Zend_Exception if no entry is registerd for $index.

getInstance( ) : Zend_Registry

Description

Retrieves the default registry instance.

Return value

Type Description
Zend_Registry

init( ) : void

Description

Initialize the default registry instance.

Return value

Type Description
void

isRegistered( string   $index, ) : boolean

Description

Returns TRUE if the $index is a named value in the registry, or FALSE if $index was not found in the registry.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$index string |

Return value

Type Description
boolean

offsetExists( string   $index, ) : n/a

Description


Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$index string |

Return value

Type Description
n/a n/a

Tags

Name Description
returns mixed Workaround for http://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=40442 (ZF-960).

set( string   $index, mixed   $value, ) : void

Description

setter method, basically same as offsetSet().

This method can be called from an object of type Zend_Registry, or it can be called statically. In the latter case, it uses the default static instance stored in the class.


Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$index string | The location in the ArrayObject in which to store the value.
$value mixed | The object to store in the ArrayObject.

Return value

Type Description
void

setClassName( string   $registryClassName = Zend_Registry, ) : void

Description

Set the class name to use for the default registry instance.

Does not affect the currently initialized instance, it only applies for the next time you instantiate.


Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$registryClassName string | Zend_Registry

Return value

Type Description
void

Tags

Name Description
throws Zend_Exception if the registry is initialized or if the class name is not valid.

setInstance( Zend_Registry   $registry, ) : void

Description

Set the default registry instance to a specified instance.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$registry Zend_Registry | An object instance of type Zend_Registry, or a subclass.

Return value

Type Description
void

Tags

Name Description
throws Zend_Exception if registry is already initialized.

Registry object provides storage for shared objects.Zend_Registry
